title: Trump Jr. Blasts London’s Mayor For Calling Terror Attacks ‘Part Of Living In Big City’
text:
CNN Investigates: ‘Is The President Afraid Of Stairs?’ 
Khan’s statement last September was in response to the Chelsea bombing near New York City which wounded 29 people with homemade explosives. The London mayor was in New York on business at the time of the blast, which U.S. authorities said was connected to terrorism. 
“It is a reality, I’m afraid, that London, New York, other major cities around the world have got to be prepared for these sorts of things,” said Khan when asked his reaction to the Chelsea attack. “That means being vigilant, having a police force that is in touch with communities, it means the security services being ready, but also it means exchanging ideas and best practice.” 
Trump Jr. received plenty of criticism for his comments by others on Twitter. Is this helpful @DonaldJTrumpJr ? Did you even read the article before goading London’s Mayor during a live incident? https://t.co/Sm68UOcJQG 
— Ciaran Jenkins (@C4Ciaran) March 22, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
“Khan is right. These things happen. We fight against them. But we don’t wildly over-react or let them change our way of life,” London-based tech guru Tom Coates said, adding that he had lived through IRA bombings. @DonaldJTrumpJr And we absolutely don’t choose to scapegoat whole communities to make ourselves feel better. Now shut the hell up. 
— Tom Coates (@tomcoates) March 22, 2017 
Khan has been a vocal critic of President Donald Trump, calling him “ignorant” and urging British Prime Minister Theresa May to cancel a planned visit from Trump to the United Kingdom. 
In February, he called Trump’s travel ban “cruel,” saying he should not get VIP treatment when he comes to Britain. 
He’s also welcomed Americans interested in emigrating to London after Trump’s election in November. Advertisement - story continues below
